result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called @ 10:00 AM Defendant Todd P. Peterson in court.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant is requesting additional time to obtain counsel. The Court reviews the options regarding obtaining counsel with the DE. AIA Scheduled - NOH Given.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case called @ 1:09 PM: Defendant Todd P. Peterson appeared by Zoom, in custody.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by Zoom for Todd P. Peterson. Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. DE is not eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders: $1500 cash bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given. Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
